TextSection.Contents: A rare mature T-cell neoplasm characterized by proliferation of small to medium-sized prolymphocytes with a mature post-thymic T-cell phenotype involving the peripheral blood bone marrow lymph nodes liver spleen and sometimes the skin. T-cell receptor genes are clonally rearranged. Patients typically present with hepatosplenomegaly generalized lymphadenopathy high leukocyte count with normal serum immunoglobulins anemia and thrombocytopenia. HTLV-1 serology is negative. The disease course is aggressive with generally poor prognosis.
